intro: Callicarpa candicans var. ponapensis, commonly known as the Ponapé beautyberry, is a shrub native to the Caroline Islands. It is characterized by its clusters of small, bright purple berries that appear in late summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are usually smooth and dark green. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. The berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for local wildlife.
